description: This schema represents a roll, i.e., a rotation around a longitudinal axis that passes through the device from its top to bottom.

angular_velocity_x.description: A pitch is a rotation around a lateral axis that passes through the device from side to side.

angular_velocity_y.description: The roll of the device, in radians

angular_velocity_z.description: A yaw is a rotation around an axis that runs vertically through the device. It is perpendicular to the body of the device, with its origin at the center of gravity and directed toward the bottom of the device. Azimuth seems to be used to represent an absolute heading, while yaw is a measurement of how much a craft turns from its current orientation.
